sense.name: information, usually new
sense.commentary: A piece or pieces of information, usually timely and specific. Often something reported in newspapers or newscasts.
sense.examples: They awaited news of the outcome. No news is good news, I guess. We received news that the enemy is planning a surprise attack! News of my death was greatly exaggerated. Have you heard the news?

sense.name: information someone has never heard
sense.commentary: Used in specific expressions. Something can come as news to a person, meaning that they've never heard it before. The phrasal "news to" is probably the only way this sense appears.
sense.examples: This is news to me. Is this coming as news to you?

sense.name: media devoted to news
sense.commentary: Programs, papers, etc. that communicate timely information. Usually used with "the"
sense.examples: There was a story on the news about a car accident down the road. I read the news today, oh boy. My mother's name appeared in the news. We watch the news at seven o'clock every night.

sense.name: having notability
sense.commentary: NEWS[+event] Describes something or somebody that is news-worthy or interesting.
sense.examples: He is no longer news in the fashion world. "Dog bites man" is nothing, but "man bites dog" is news!
